description.narrative: Technology Transfer and Market Development for Small-Hydropower in Tajikistan. The objective of the project is to significantly accelerate the development of small-scale hydropower (SHP)
capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Adapted and enhanced legislative and regulatory framework for smallscale hydropower development in the country
Adopted regulation operationalizing RES Law

comment.narrative: No regulations in support of RES Law
Rules and regulations adopted by end of Year 1

The legislative and regulatory frameworks for small scale hydropower development created in the previous years with the projects support the law on Renewable Energy Sources and the law on Energy efficiency and energy saving have led the Government to adoption of strategic documents in favor of renewable energy development As such the national programme for small hydropower plants construction was revised and the national strategy for the development of renewable energy sources and energy efficiency is being developed The revised national programme that will cover the period of 20152020 will include the small hydro solar and wind energy sources and during the reporting period the programme is being adopted
Adopted sublaws to the law on Renewable Energy Sources also regulate the conditions for the solar and wind energy sources although the project does not directly aim at development of these sources Nevertheless the latest developments of renewables in the country suggest that combined application of renewable sources along with small hydropower would better address the issues with the lack of energy in the rural communities The project has therefore been effective in communicating this message to the government which was endorsed
Rules and regulations adopted by end of Year 1

The legislative and regulatory frameworks for small scale hydropower development created in the previous years with the projects support the law on Renewable Energy Sources and the law on Energy efficiency and energy saving have led the Government to adoption of strategic documents in favor of renewable energy development As such the national programme for small hydropower plants construction was revised and the national strategy for the development of renewable energy sources and energy efficiency is being developed The revised national programme that will cover the period of 20152020 will include the small hydro solar and wind energy sources and during the reporting period the programme is being adopted
Adopted sublaws to the law on Renewable Energy Sources also regulate the conditions for the solar and wind energy sources although the project does not directly aim at development of these sources Nevertheless the latest developments of renewables in the country suggest that combined application of renewable sources along with small hydropower would better address the issues with the lack of energy in the rural communities The project has therefore been effective in communicating this message to the government which was endorsed

description.narrative: Approved and funded proposal for national scaling up of the SHP demospilots
Annual amount of governmental incentives allocated to support investment in new SHP plants under the scaleup plan by EOP in USD

comment.narrative: Considering the recommendations and policy advice of the project in 2012 2014 the Government has provided direct investments in SHPPs construction that cumulatively constitutes USD 44 mln for 5 SHPPs The total capacity of the commissioned SHPPs is 1967 kW

Considering the recommendations and policy advice of the project in 2012 2014 the Government has provided direct investments in SHPPs construction that cumulatively constitutes USD 44 mln for 5 SHPPs The total capacity of the commissioned SHPPs is 1967 kW

description.narrative: Central and local government institutions with enhanced capacities to develop and coordinate SHP projects
staff members from relevant central and local government institutions trained in developing and coordinating SHP projects

comment.narrative: 30 staff members trained by the end of Year 2

In addition to the trainings carried out by the project for the Government representatives during the previous reporting year the capacity assessment of the Ministry of Energy and Water Resources staff was conducted It has been revealed that there is a significant gap in the planning of RES projects especially in the financial and economic analysis of the SHPP projects which creates a barrier for adequately managing and coordinating resources expanded for the construction of SHPPs In this regard the project in cooperation with EU Sustainable Energy Programme for Central Asia CASEP and direct involvement of the projects Chief Technical Adviser organized 3days trainings on Creating and managing the SHPP cadastre Business game Practical development of RES projects and Financial and economic analysis of SHPP projects which have helped to increase the capacity of 45 staff of the Ministry of Energy and Water Resources and Barki Tojik the national electricity utility company
30 staff members trained by the end of Year 2

In addition to the trainings carried out by the project for the Government representatives during the previous reporting year the capacity assessment of the Ministry of Energy and Water Resources staff was conducted It has been revealed that there is a significant gap in the planning of RES projects especially in the financial and economic analysis of the SHPP projects which creates a barrier for adequately managing and coordinating resources expanded for the construction of SHPPs In this regard the project in cooperation with EU Sustainable Energy Programme for Central Asia CASEP and direct involvement of the projects Chief Technical Adviser organized 3days trainings on Creating and managing the SHPP cadastre Business game Practical development of RES projects and Financial and economic analysis of SHPP projects which have helped to increase the capacity of 45 staff of the Ministry of Energy and Water Resources and Barki Tojik the national electricity utility company

description.narrative: Enhanced technical and planning knowhow and developed market chain for SHP in Tajikistan
of the total SHP installed cost provided by locally made goods and services

comment.narrative: 50 by the end of Year 4

In line with the developed regulations for SHP development the capacities to produce maintain and operate SHPPs were created through the transfer of technology to beneficiary companies Energoremont and Korgohi Mashinasozi and through educating students at the Technical universities in Dushanbe and Kurgantyube The local manufacturers supported by the project have produced tested and installed portable turbines where the share of locally produced goods and services is estimated at over 50 The companies are now engaged in the production and installation of electromechanical equipment for additional 4 SHPPs
The human capacity of the technicians and experts in SHPP development and management is being built through the project Annually a total of 100 students from the technical universities are taking SHPP courses based on the modules developed with the projects support To date 300 students have been reported to have received these courses at the Tajik Technical University and Kurgantyube Energy Institute
50 by the end of Year 4

In line with the developed regulations for SHP development the capacities to produce maintain and operate SHPPs were created through the transfer of technology to beneficiary companies Energoremont and Korgohi Mashinasozi and through educating students at the Technical universities in Dushanbe and Kurgantyube The local manufacturers supported by the project have produced tested and installed portable turbines where the share of locally produced goods and services is estimated at over 50 The companies are now engaged in the production and installation of electromechanical equipment for additional 4 SHPPs
The human capacity of the technicians and experts in SHPP development and management is being built through the project Annually a total of 100 students from the technical universities are taking SHPP courses based on the modules developed with the projects support To date 300 students have been reported to have received these courses at the Tajik Technical University and Kurgantyube Energy Institute

description.narrative: Formulated approved and enforced implementing rules and regulations IRRs of the new Law for RES that will facilitate actions geared towards the enhancement of the market environment for SHP

Simplified procedures and principles for the licensing and construction of SHP facilities
National REEE Fund

comment.narrative:
RES Law includes a number of provisions to facilitate investment in gridconnected RE projects but they are not operationalized
National REEE Fund

Procedures adopted and enforced by end of Year 1
National REEE Fund setup and is operational by end of Year 2

A permanent interinstitutional working group for the implementation of the law on energy saving and energy efficiency and elaboration of proposals to implement the law has been established Interinstitutional working group has 3 subgroups responsible for i issues related to establishment of Trust Fund for RES and EE ii development of the National Strategy on RES and National energy saving program and iii development of legal acts The group is chaired by the Ministry of energy and water resources
The charter of the Trust Fund has been revised to best meet the current developments in the renewable energy sector and was endorsed by 5 ministries except for the Ministry of Finance The financial part of the trust fund still remains unresolved due to the lack of financial commitments from the main international institutions operating in the country that were considered as the primary source of funds along with the national contributions It has to be mentioned however that the share of the national contribution remains unknown and requires further discussions

Procedures adopted and enforced by end of Year 1
National REEE Fund setup and is operational by end of Year 2

A permanent interinstitutional working group for the implementation of the law on energy saving and energy efficiency and elaboration of proposals to implement the law has been established Interinstitutional working group has 3 subgroups responsible for i issues related to establishment of Trust Fund for RES and EE ii development of the National Strategy on RES and National energy saving program and iii development of legal acts The group is chaired by the Ministry of energy and water resources
The charter of the Trust Fund has been revised to best meet the current developments in the renewable energy sector and was endorsed by 5 ministries except for the Ministry of Finance The financial part of the trust fund still remains unresolved due to the lack of financial commitments from the main international institutions operating in the country that were considered as the primary source of funds along with the national contributions It has to be mentioned however that the share of the national contribution remains unknown and requires further discussions

description.narrative: Improved confidence on the technical and economic viability of integrated SHPbased rural development model
No of SHP demospilots incorporating aspects of productive uses and livelihood support for host communities

comment.narrative: At least 5 communityowned SHP projects operate on a sustainable basis and at least 5 additional are under construction by the end of Year 4

Total of 3 communityowned SHPPs Nurofar Yazghulam and Sorvo are operating on sustainable basis and 4 more are under construction Sustainability of the constructed SHPPs is ensured through the introduced management mechanisms fee collection methods capacity building of the operators through trainings and provision of basic equipment Additionally SHPP Nurofar sells excess electricity to the local businesses fuel station dairy shop and the plastic windows production workshop during the summer time based on contractual agreement This measure allows the SHPP to operate on sustainable basis as well as allowing the local businesses to have savings from the electricity bills The national tariff for businesses is 33 dirams per kW 005 USD whereas the SHPP offers a trade off electricity for 25 dirams per kW 0038 USD
At least 5 communityowned SHP projects operate on a sustainable basis and at least 5 additional are under construction by the end of Year 4

Total of 3 communityowned SHPPs Nurofar Yazghulam and Sorvo are operating on sustainable basis and 4 more are under construction Sustainability of the constructed SHPPs is ensured through the introduced management mechanisms fee collection methods capacity building of the operators through trainings and provision of basic equipment Additionally SHPP Nurofar sells excess electricity to the local businesses fuel station dairy shop and the plastic windows production workshop during the summer time based on contractual agreement This measure allows the SHPP to operate on sustainable basis as well as allowing the local businesses to have savings from the electricity bills The national tariff for businesses is 33 dirams per kW 005 USD whereas the SHPP offers a trade off electricity for 25 dirams per kW 0038 USD

description.narrative: Local manufacturers capable of producing combined electric and biomassfired heating and cooking devices for rural households
of local craft workshops capable of manufacturing and assemblage of simple efficient and lowcost electric heating and cooking devices

comment.narrative: At least 1 local craft workshops by the end of Year 3

A Project study on the viability of producing the combined electrical and biomass fired heating and cooking device indicates that production of the devices locally will not be sustained a Local power supplies of 1 kW will not be sufficient to operate the device reducing its demand and b limited demand for these devices is expected due to the flooding of less expensive Chinese goods The target is to be cancelled based on the recommendations of the MidTerm Review
At least 1 local craft workshops by the end of Year 3

A Project study on the viability of producing the combined electrical and biomass fired heating and cooking device indicates that production of the devices locally will not be sustained a Local power supplies of 1 kW will not be sufficient to operate the device reducing its demand and b limited demand for these devices is expected due to the flooding of less expensive Chinese goods The target is to be cancelled based on the recommendations of the MidTerm Review

description.narrative: Local workshops and manufacturers with enhanced capacities to install construct manufacture and repair SHP system equipment and components
Technology transfer and capacity development plan prepared for selected local manufacturers

comment.narrative: 2 technology transfer and capacity development plan prepared by the end of Year 1

The capacities of the local manufacturers Energoremont and Korgohi Mashinasozi to design manufacture construct install and repair the SHP systems are further enhanced The local manufacturers have received additional sets of needed equipment for the production of the SHPPs that include electronic and mechanical tools and equipment
Under the supervision and direct coaching of the technology transfer deliverer the local manufacturers have mastered the production of the portable turbines 2 x 15 kW that were installed and commissioned on a pilot basis Based on this experience the manufacturers have been prepared for the manufacturing construction installation and repair of larger electromechanical equipment for SHPPs Both manufacturers are now able to produce turbines and set into operation SHPPs of ranging capacities from 1 kW to 1000 kW
2 technology transfer and capacity development plan prepared by the end of Year 1

The capacities of the local manufacturers Energoremont and Korgohi Mashinasozi to design manufacture construct install and repair the SHP systems are further enhanced The local manufacturers have received additional sets of needed equipment for the production of the SHPPs that include electronic and mechanical tools and equipment
Under the supervision and direct coaching of the technology transfer deliverer the local manufacturers have mastered the production of the portable turbines 2 x 15 kW that were installed and commissioned on a pilot basis Based on this experience the manufacturers have been prepared for the manufacturing construction installation and repair of larger electromechanical equipment for SHPPs Both manufacturers are now able to produce turbines and set into operation SHPPs of ranging capacities from 1 kW to 1000 kW

description.narrative: National Scalingup Programme of Renewable Energybased Integrated Rural Development
Adopted and financed National Scalingup Program

comment.narrative: Na
Adopted and financed National Scalingup Program by the end of Year 4

Through continuous dialogue and political advice rendered to the government counterparts by the project and the international community operating in the energy sector the Government has and is adopting a number of strategies in the energy sector one of which is the National Strategy for Renewable Energy and corresponding action plans and national programmes The programme and the strategies aim at scalingup renewable energy based integrated rural development
For instance the government has already provided direct investments for SHP construction In 2012 2014 the amount invested by the Government cumulatively constituted USD 44 mln for 5 SHPPs with a total capacity of 1967 kW This investment has resulted in covering 1500 households schools hospitals as well as the business facilities and created employment for 200 people in remote rural areas of the country
Adopted and financed National Scalingup Program by the end of Year 4

Through continuous dialogue and political advice rendered to the government counterparts by the project and the international community operating in the energy sector the Government has and is adopting a number of strategies in the energy sector one of which is the National Strategy for Renewable Energy and corresponding action plans and national programmes The programme and the strategies aim at scalingup renewable energy based integrated rural development
For instance the government has already provided direct investments for SHP construction In 2012 2014 the amount invested by the Government cumulatively constituted USD 44 mln for 5 SHPPs with a total capacity of 1967 kW This investment has resulted in covering 1500 households schools hospitals as well as the business facilities and created employment for 200 people in remote rural areas of the country

description.narrative: Pilot SHP operations sustained

Number of PPAs signed for purchase of power from pilot SHP plants by EOP
Number of local business supported in pilot localities

comment.narrative:
At least 2 by the end of Year 3
5 by the end of Year 4

The operation of the two commissioned pilot SHPPs in Burunov and Yazghulom are sustained by regular monitoring and provided technical support to the operators responsible for the operationmaintenance and management of the plants The operators of these plants have been educated through the vocational trainings and have been supplied with the maintenance tools and equipment The SHPP in Yazghulam that provides electricity to the border outpost on the TajikAfghan border is sustained by the technicians serving in the border post The plant in Burunov on the other hand provides electricity to a number of clients including the households and the social and economic facilities and has been connected to the national grid Both SHPPs are operating in a sustainable manner

At least 2 by the end of Year 3
5 by the end of Year 4

The operation of the two commissioned pilot SHPPs in Burunov and Yazghulom are sustained by regular monitoring and provided technical support to the operators responsible for the operationmaintenance and management of the plants The operators of these plants have been educated through the vocational trainings and have been supplied with the maintenance tools and equipment The SHPP in Yazghulam that provides electricity to the border outpost on the TajikAfghan border is sustained by the technicians serving in the border post The plant in Burunov on the other hand provides electricity to a number of clients including the households and the social and economic facilities and has been connected to the national grid Both SHPPs are operating in a sustainable manner

description.narrative: Significantly accelerate the development of smallscale hydropower SHP by removing barriers through enabling legal and regulatory framework capacity building and developing sustainable delivery models thus substantially avoiding the use of conventional biomass and fossil fuels for power and other energy needs
No of operational demopilot SHP plants by EOP

comment.narrative:
Total of 3 SHPPs have been constructed and commissioned while 4 more SHPPs are in pipeline
The total cumulative capacity of the constructed and commissioned SHPPs is 245 kW that annually generate 1288 MWhyear
The 4 additional SHPPs that are in the pipeline will have a total cumulative installed capacity of 475 kW able to generate 2460 MWhyear of electricity

The feasibility studies have been completed in the previous reporting period
The IDDPs for 5 districts have been reviewed and updated accordingly
5 SHPPs with a total capacity of 1967 kW was constructed by the Government Additionally OSCE has supported the construction of 2 micro SHPPs 10 kW each in Rasht Valley IFC has signed an agreement with the Ministry of Energy and Water Resources for the construction of 18 MW hydropower plant in Zervashan valley The Japan Government funded Livelihoods Improvement in TajikistanAfghanistan Cross border Areas LITACA project implemented by UNDP finances construction of 2 SHPPs in Shurabad and Jilikul districts The electromechanical equipment for these two SHPPs 175 kW and 100 kW will be produced by the local manufacturers supported by the project

description.narrative: Vocational training program for technicians involved in SHP designconstruction and OM
of technicians annually undertaking vocational training on SHP

comment.narrative: 20 technicians annually undertaking vocational training on SHP starting from Year 2

The project has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the TajikTechnical University to provide vocational trainings to technicians involved in SHP production Based on the signed MoU the project has helped the university in developing the vocational training modules and provided IT equipment a laptop overhead projector and a screen In August 2014 3day vocational trainings for 18 technicians from Vahdat district and 7 representatives of the Ministries of Energy of Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan were held The practical trainings were carried out on the facilities of Energoremont and Korgohi Mashinasozi with which the University has agreements
In September 2014 the OSCE office in Dushanbe has requested the services of the University to educate 15 technicians in Rasht valley
20 technicians annually undertaking vocational training on SHP starting from Year 2

In September 2014 the OSCE office in Dushanbe has requested the services of the University to educate 15 technicians in Rasht valley
